conversation.content: True or False? If ($x_n$) is bounded and diverges, then there exist two subsequences of ($x_n$) that converge to different limits.

True. If a bounded sequence diverges, it means it does not converge to a single limit. By the Bolzano-Weierstrass theorem, every bounded sequence has a convergent subsequence. Since the original sequence diverges, there must be at least two subsequences converging to different limits.
